page.title: 14POULTRY FARM, NR. COVENTRY.
page.content: Marston Hall was built in{1752}.The present owner is one of the leading poultry farmers in{BRITAIN}. His farm consists of two sites, Marston Hall with 9000 birds and Marston Maples with 11000 birds.{4500}birds are housed in a shed {250}feet long. There are{9 cockerels}to every{100 pullets . They are{fed at 8.30 a.m.}and the eggs are collected at{9.00 a.m., noon and {2.30 p.m. The eggs are washed and cleaned in disinfectent by machine. They stored in a cool room and later transported to the hatchery. The eggs take{21}days to hatch. At this time they are returned to the sheds and start laying at{24}weeks. They are kept in the sheds for{60} weeks and are then sent off to the meat packers.
